credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
title: Recto Title: Page of a sketchbook showing two scenes, one including the Blinding of Cyclops.
medium: Bistre, pen and ink, wash, on paper
description: Vertical rectangle.  Recto, top: Scene in cave of Cyclops, the giant in the foreground lying on his side, his head supported by his left hand.  A group of men are blinding his single eye with a spear.  Flock of Cyclops in background; below: A group of figures stand around a stone platform on which lies a man who is being eaten by an animal.  Verso, Figures in a grotto, at right.  Prow of ship at left.  Other figures on incline, left.
name: Drawing
